summary:
I am an Anthropologist, currently working as study coach and social guidance counselor. I obtained my Bachelor of Science in 2018, my Master of Science in 2020, my first Master of Arts in 2021 and my second Master of Arts in 2023.

I am fluent in three international languages (Dutch, English and Spanish)  and I have lived (studied and worked) in eight countries (Thailand, Egypt, Switzerland, Bolivia, Spain, Greece, Guatemala and United Kingdom).

My professional experience includes tutoring, social mentorship, counseling, and educating. 

My interests and passions are generally centred around women/children psychology/welfare, minorities and gender/intercultural diversity.

projects.title: University of the Aegean - Digital Innovation and Start-Up Entrepreneurship
projects.description:
The 11th International Summer School on Digital Innovation and Startup Entrepreneurship - DigiBus2023 is designed to introduce attendees to the world of start-ups and multi-channel marketing and provide them with the advanced technical skills needed to identify, engage, and develop relationships with customers in a digital environment.

Organized by the University of the Aegean, Department of Information & Communication Systems Engineering, 3 – 8 July 2023, it is taking place on the island of Samos, Greece.

contributors.headline: Sustainable Finance | ESG | Scientific Research & Writing

projects.title: University of Palermo
projects.description: The University of Palermo offers a summer school on Migrants, Human Rights, and Democracy, a 5-day course focusing specifically on the fields of forced migration, human mobility, refugees, and Roma studies. Students will gain insight into relevant topics such as migrants and religion, cultural heritages, vulnerability assessment, Syrian refugees, human trafficking, social inclusion, family reunification, and more. Students will learn from expert academics from universities around the world through lectures, workshops, discussions, case studies, and a day trip.

projects.title: Netherlands Institute Athens
projects.description: The Institute aims to promote and support Dutch scholars of all academic disciplines active in Greece. To achieve this, the Institute organizes courses, lectures, conferences, maintains a program of study grants and provides students and scholars with lodgings and the necessary study permits. The Netherlands Institute at Athens (NIA) selected me for a summer school program called "Visual Ethnography of Cityscapes". I had lectures and l conducted fieldwork for a period of 4 weeks. I created the short film "Recurring Melodies" together with 2 international students.

projects.title: Runawasi Language School
projects.description:
Escuela Runawasi is a language school that has been endorsed by Bolivia’s Ministry of Education and Culture. I got lessons for 25 hours a week (intensive course) for a period of 16 weeks. Those lessons were private and teachers changed everyday.

Within those lessons I developed a Spanish version of a research report I wrote for my internship, called ''Cuáles son las percepciones del trabajo de niños en una Bolivia contemporánea y cómo prevenir el trabajo de niños? 
Un reporte de recomendación para una ONG pequeña en Cochabamba''.

projects.description: For the course 'Social Anthropology: Sensory Ethnography' did I do a fieldwork research whereby I followed an African immigrant during his journey in Switzerland. We documented the difficulties and successes.

profile_positions.description: As a member of the Examination Committee, I have the task of guaranteeing the quality of education regarding the curricula of SDO Hogeschool (Modern Business Administration).
profile_positions.title: Member of the Examination Committee

profile_positions.description:
Our mission is guiding students by conducting scientific research and writing their study assignments and theses. We aim at providing them the necessary tools, knowledge, and skills, so that they achieve their goals and maximise their potential. We are also dedicated to boost students’ self-confidence and motivation during the process.

Our vision is to be a leading company in guiding students. We strive to offer a range of quality services that meet the unique needs of each student. We want to be known for our expertise, professionalism and personal approach. Through continuous innovation, we strive to improve our services to meet the changing needs of students and academia.

We help students in conducting scientific research and writing theses (and other writing assignments), by offering the following high-quality services:
Support with the process itself (e.g. planning)
Support with the study content (e.g. interpreting literature)
Support with developing research skills (e.g. choosing research instruments)
Support with the presentation of the assignment (e.g. writing style)
Individual and peer support can be given in one or multiple stages of the process, depending on the need of a particular student.

profile_positions.title: Lecturer in Training

profile_positions.description:
I conducted research among primary school teachers in The Netherlands. 

Summary:

Teachers are important actors in the lives of pupils, and they play an essential role in promoting 
or withholding multilingualism in classrooms. Several factors affect beliefs, attitudes, and 
knowledge towards multilingualism of primary schools teachers in the Netherlands. Although 
qualitative researches on linguistic diversity in education often have been carried out, large scale quantitative research concerning this topic has not yet been conducted in the Netherlands. 
Aspiring to fill this methodological and research gap, I gathered quantitative data, on 
which statistical (SPSS) analyses were conducted. The aim of the research was to examine 
whether personal characteristics of primary teachers in The Netherlands influence beliefs, 
attitudes, and knowledge towards multilingualism with the central research question: “Do 
personal characteristics of primary teachers in The Netherlands influence beliefs, attitudes, and 
knowledge towards multilingualism in schools?” Research among 650 primary school teachers
shows that various personal characteristics of primary teachers influence their beliefs, attitudes, 
and/or knowledge towards multilingualism, such as the amount of languages one masters, one’s 
age, whether one has a migration background or not and whether one has a different mother 
tongue from Dutch or not. It is recommended to promote multilingualism in primary schools,
for which governmental institutions, school directors and primary school teachers (in 
education) should take responsibilities.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Quantitative Researcher in Training

profile_positions.description:
I  conducted research among Frisian dairy farmers who work together on family farms.

Summary [in Dutch]:

De landbouw zit vaak diep geworteld in de identiteit van melkveehouders en bij een bedrijfsovername verlangen ouders vaak een familiale opvolger. De opvolger staat echter voor uitdagingen bij het overnemen van een boerderij. Economische motieven spelen hierbij een rol. Door de afhankelijkheid van de wereldeconomie schommelt het inkomen van melkveehouders. De financiële druk meer te produceren om een goede kostprijs te behouden staat onder druk door de belasting van het milieu. Door middel van participerende observatie, interviews, documentanalyse, open enquêtes en gesprekken met meer dan 100 informanten wordt er onderzocht wat de verschillen in agrarische aspiraties tussen de oudere en jongere generatie in familiebedrijven in de Friese melkveehouderij zijn met speciale aandacht voor economie en ecologie. Het blijkt dat behoeften veranderen. Daar waar oudere melkveehouders kracht putten uit het voortzetten van een bedrijf dat generaties lang is opgebouwd, vinden jongere melkveehouders het vaker belangrijk om voor het individuele geluk te kiezen, zoals het hebben van vrije tijd en van een duidelijke grens tussen werk- en privé. De komst van meer vrouwen in de landbouw, het veranderende onderwijs, de verwachtingen van de consument, de omgeving, de politiek-juridische dimensie en onuitgesproken verwachtingen hebben het beroep veranderd. Daarnaast zorgt het kapitaal, de schommelende melkprijs en de veranderende houding van banken voor belemmeringen voor de jongere generatie. Zij zijn bezig met het vinden van draagkracht voor de manier van produceren. De oudere generatie ‘zit de tijd uit’, terwijl de jongere generatie heel bewust kiest om melkveehouder te worden en ondanks de uitdagingen economisch en ecologisch verantwoord te ondernemen.

profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
I conducted research in cooperation with another student. Our research took place in San Juan La Laguna (Guatemala) among their indigenous population. We researched that women’s own perceptions and experiences of womanhood and motherhood are influenced by norms about gender and sexuality, (lack of) knowledge of the body, social position, economic situation and the healthcare they receive. 

Reference available upon request.
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Anthropological Researcher in Training

volunteer_experiences.description:
After highschool, I went to Thailand to participate in an organization called Tamar Center. The organization was founded in 1999 and seeks to provide hope in a city full of red-light districts. To provide healing through love, biblical principles and to provide education as well as job opportunities for girls leaving the bars. My role in this organisation was to help the girls providing with an alternative to the often devastating job as a bar girl/prostitute. I gave English lessons, helped participate in a restaurant, worked as a babysitter and went on outreach for 3 nights a week. I went out as customer to the bars, ordered a drink and communicated with the women. My main focus was to build friendships and to give the girls someone to talk to about their situation. 
It was our passion to provide the girls with alternative possibilities to the lifestyle and often devastating job as a bar girl/prostitute.

Reference available upon request.

Involved with the foundation De Tussenvoorziening to organize buddy projects . A contactbuddy who aimed to address and promote social contact. I was connected to a patient diagnosed with Korsakoff syndrome, who I undertook in social activities. Due to my long-term stay abroad, I could no longer continue this buddy project.

Reference available upon request.

I hosted a weekly event in Cochabamba, Bolivia, organized for people who are curious to learn new languages. I practiced different languages, broadened my network and got more knowledge of different cultures. I communicated in Spanish, English, Dutch and German. 

Reference available upon request.

As an event manager I was responsible for the organization of several non-profit meetings. Those meetings took place in Mae West, La Plaza and Ganivet. The public existed of around 40 to 100 international students. The concepts I created are "Cena Internacional", which is an international dinner whereby every participant prepares a plate of food, and "Postre Paradise", which is a meeting whereby every participant prepares a dessert. I tried to connect people and to let the barrier of different languages disappear. I communicated in English and Spanish. 

Reference available upon request.

EMYCET (En Movimiento Y Contra El Tiempo) is a travel agency that realizes trips in a multicultural environment. I helped EMYCET to organize trips to different locations including among others Gibraltar, Barcelona, Sierra Nevada, Ronda, Toledo, Córdoba, Algarve, Lisbon. My tasks included (but not limited to) promoting the events, preparing itinerary and conducting due diligence relating to tourism events. I also worked as a translator for the company. 

Reference available upon request.
